channel.title: NPR Topics: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Populist conservative Laura Fernández wins Costa Rica's presidential election
item.description: Candidate Laura Fernández won a resounding victory, promising to continue the aggressive reorienting of the Central American nation's politics started by her predecessor.
item.content:encoded:
Candidate Laura Fernández won a resounding victory, promising to continue the aggressive reorienting of the Central American nation's politics started by her predecessor.

(Image credit: Carlos Borbon)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: What Jared Kushner's 'New Gaza' plan includes, and what it leaves out
item.description: President Trump's son-in-law Jared Kushner laid out a plan for a "New Gaza." A close look suggests it makes room for fewer Palestinians and less housing.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump's son-in-law Jared Kushner laid out a plan for a "New Gaza." A close look suggests it makes room for fewer Palestinians and less housing.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy

item.title: Gaza's Rafah border crossing with Egypt slated to reopen
item.description: Israel says it has allowed Gaza's Rafah border crossing with Egypt to reopen, a key step in the Israel-Hamas ceasefire agreement. No one has crossed yet.
item.content:encoded: Israel says it has allowed Gaza's Rafah border crossing with Egypt to reopen, a key step in the Israel-Hamas ceasefire agreement. No one has crossed yet.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: After Trump's threats, Iran's supreme leader warns attack would spark 'regional war'
item.description: The U.S. is continuing its military buildup in the Middle East, with President Trump hinting at a possible attack. Iran struck back this weekend, warning of a regional war if the U.S. attacks.
item.content:encoded: The U.S. is continuing its military buildup in the Middle East, with President Trump hinting at a possible attack. Iran struck back this weekend, warning of a regional war if the U.S. attacks.
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre

item.title: Iran warns U.S. attack would spark regional war. What's next for the country?
item.description: After President Trump sent an armada to the Middle East, Iran's Supreme Leader warned a U.S. attack would spark regional war. The International Crisis Group's Ali Vaez talks about what's next.
item.content:encoded: After President Trump sent an armada to the Middle East, Iran's Supreme Leader warned a U.S. attack would spark regional war. The International Crisis Group's Ali Vaez talks about what's next.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: Gaza's Rafah border crossing with Egypt reopens for limited traffic
item.description: Gaza's Rafah border crossing with Egypt reopened on Monday for limited traffic, a key step as the Israeli-Hamas ceasefire moves ahead, according to Egyptian and Israeli security officials.
item.content:encoded:
Gaza's Rafah border crossing with Egypt reopened on Monday for limited traffic, a key step as the Israeli-Hamas ceasefire moves ahead, according to Egyptian and Israeli security officials.

(Image credit: Mohammed Arafat)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: What does normal look like in Caracas one month after the Maduro operation?
item.description: Nearly a month after U.S. forces seized Nicolás Maduro, Caracas is settling into an uneasy normal, with major changes and lingering questions about what lasts and what comes next.
item.content:encoded: Nearly a month after U.S. forces seized Nicolás Maduro, Caracas is settling into an uneasy normal, with major changes and lingering questions about what lasts and what comes next.
item.dc:creator: Manuel Rueda

item.title: Swiss Alpine bar fire claims 41st victim, an 18-year-old Swiss national
item.description: Swiss prosecutors have opened a criminal investigation into the owners of Le Constellation bar in the ski resort of Crans-Montana, where a fire in the early hours of Jan. 1 killed dozens.
item.content:encoded:
Swiss prosecutors have opened a criminal investigation into the owners of Le Constellation bar in the ski resort of Crans-Montana, where a fire in the early hours of Jan. 1 killed dozens.

(Image credit: Cyril Zingaro)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: At a clown school near Paris, failure is the lesson
item.description: For decades, students at the Ecole Philippe Gaulier have been paying to bomb onstage. The goal isn't laughs — it's learning how to take the humiliation and keep going.
item.content:encoded:
For decades, students at the Ecole Philippe Gaulier have been paying to bomb onstage. The goal isn't laughs — it's learning how to take the humiliation and keep going.

(Image credit: Rebecca Rosman for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Rosman

item.title: In the world's driest desert, Chile freezes its future to protect plants
item.description: Tucked away in a remote desert town, a hidden vault safeguards Chile's most precious natural treasures. From long-forgotten flowers to endangered crops.
item.content:encoded:
Tucked away in a remote desert town, a hidden vault safeguards Chile's most precious natural treasures. From long-forgotten flowers to endangered crops.

(Image credit: John Bartlett for NPR)
item.dc:creator: John Bartlett
